data.title: Ordinary food, overpriced
data.text:
This place is now called Crossroads, and the hotel is now a Sheraton. There is not much else in walking distance so I ate dinner and had the breakfast buffet. The burger for dinner was ok, but the fries on the side were soggy and bits and pieces. 

The breakfast buffet was the same items you get at a Hyatt house or Hampton inn. Quality was similar to Hyatt house and slightly better than Hampton, but either way overpriced for what was served.

data.title: Pre-race dinner
data.text: I know. I should have eaten light, but the burgers on e menu looked too good to pass up. I got their classic bacon cheeseburger with fries. I also order Mac n cheese on the side. Big did I ever stuff myself on it all. The only thing I didn't finish were the fries, even though they were very tasty. The sweet tea was great. I had three glasses of it. I would definitely eat here again if I come to the St. Jude's marathon next year!

data.title: Classy Brunch Spot
data.text: The food was quite tasty. Higher quality and service than your average brunch spot. I would suggest going when they first open or making a reservation. They start you off with some biscuits and jelly. Then I had the andouille sausage frittata and a pancake. The frittata covered the whole plate and I only ate half of it. Not because it wasn't deelish but because I was too full. Great ambiance especially for couples or 4-top. We went on a Sunday morning for brunch so there was also live music.

data.title: Great variety
data.text: Great fish and fries. Just the right amount of crispy batter on the fish and right amount of salt on the fries.  Nice variety of flat bread pizzas and the wrapped sandwiches are very good.  If you like old movies, there will always be one playing on large screen as you eat.  Desserts are awesome.

data.title: BEST Ribs!
data.text: I went there twice in my 6 day stay because the ribs and service were sooooo good!  My second trip included 7 others (at my recommendation) one who was in a wheel chair  The staff could not have been nicer including our waiter, Joe.  The ribs were as good as the first time I went.

data.title: Horrible service at hotel restaurant
data.text: I went here to eat with some business colleagues, and the service was the worst.  We had to wait for a table, and then we waited almost an hour for the food.  The food was average at best.  Some people were here last year and it was just as bad.  Do yourself a favor and go anywhere else.

data.title: Great Brunch
data.text: Love the renovation of the old movie theater and keeping the theme.  The brunch is outstanding.  Order the Eggs Benedict with mimosas.  Sitting on the upper level gives you a great view to see others enjoying a great meal.

data.title: Limited Selection But Great Food
data.text: Don't miss the Bananas Foster. The service was quick and pleasant. The regular breakfast is much better than the buffet.

data.title: Good breakfast Buffett
data.text: We had breakfast during our stay at our convention. The breakfast Buffett was wonderful. The cost was reasonable for hotel Resturant. They did need more servers during a convention time however.

data.title: Their Sunday Brunch Is To Sigh For
data.text: We ate at the Magnolia Grille four times while we were in Memphis. The location (in the hotel) was very convenient for us, and the food was very good. The Sunday brunch (a brunch to sigh for) was even more outstanding with its wide variety of wonderful choices. I loved the made-to-order omelette station and the friendly chefs who prepared our requests. I tried breakfast, lunch, dinner and Sunday brunch at the Magnolia, and was very pleased with each experience. It is a bit pricey, but we were on vacation and couldn't really complain about splurging a little. Well done (no pun intended)!

data.title: Great Food
data.text: This place had great food and most of the staff is quick and friendly.  I ate there 6 times during my stay and had on bad waiter.  I think he was a fill in and was not sure of what he needed to do.  I would go back and eat there again when I am back in town

data.title: Pleasant hotel restaurant
data.text: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott whilst we were in Memphis and we really enjoyed the food here especially the ribs and the braised beef.Service was good and the staff were pleasant.

data.title: Romantic & Cozy
data.text:
This restaurant was delicious and recommended by our driver Love who works for the Crowne Plaza! Try the gumbo for an appetizer - it is spicy and perfect. I had the grilled salmon and it was cooked perfectly and served with crisp fresh asparagus. David had the seared tuna which was to die for yummy.
Service was friendly and prompt.  
My #1 issue was they are stingy with the wine - I am not sure how many ounces was in my glass but for $9 it wasn't much. Well....I'm from Texas and just maybe everything IS bigger there - even the wine portions LOL

data.title: Convenient
data.text:
Nice setting in the lobby of the Marriott - Downtown Memphis property.
Average food from a limited menu. Was very surprised with the good taste and quality of the Onion Soup.
Service was adequate but slow, on a slow evening.
Just a ''Nothing Special Spot'

data.title: Spare Ribs zum aufgeben
data.text: Wir haben Bilder ohne Ende von den Tellern - leider haben wir den Kellner nur fragend angeschaut als er uns fragte, ob wir die halbe oder ganze Spare Ribs Portion wollten - die ganze ist der Hammer und nicht aufzuessen... Schönes Restaurant an der Cable Car Strecke - zu empfehlen
